p: Energy displacement factors were first estimated assuming provincial average fuel mix and energy consumption (Table 3). The displacement factor for Cranbrook was relatively high (0.95) because of the population of 47 k people and their associated electricity and fossil-intensive heat demand. In contrast, the small population within the Dog River FMU had a low energy demand, and most of the harvest residues were converted to electricity that was used to displace low emissions grid electricity (Table 4, Additional file 1: Table S3), resulting in a low displacement factor of 0.38.
